document.heading: Petition Circulation Requirements Amendment Act of 1999

history.narrative: Law 13-64, the “Petition Circulation Requirements Amendment Act of 1999,” was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 13-82, which was referred to the Committee on Government Operations. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on September 21, 1999, and on October 5, 1999, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on October 25, 1999, it was assigned Act No. 13-165 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 13-64 became effective on March 31, 2000.
